Nachos Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
ACIADefines an ACIA (Asynchronous Communication Interface Adapter) device
ACIA_sysdep
AddrSpaceDefines the data structures to keep track of memory resources of executing user programs (address spaces)
BackingStoreImplements the swap manager
BitMapDefines a "bitmap" -- an array of bits
BookTableEntryDefines an entry in a top-level translation table Used only if a two-level translation table is selected
ConditionDefines the "condition variable" synchronization tool
ConfigDefines Nachos hardware and software configuration
ConsoleDefines a hardware console device
DCacheDefines a simple data cache
DCacheLine
DirectoryDefines a UNIX-like "directory"
DirectoryEntryDefines a directory entry
DiskDefines a physical disk I/O device
DriverACIADefines an ACIA (Asynchronous Communication Interface Adapter) device driver
DriverConsoleDefines a "synchronous" console abstraction
DriverDiskDefines a "synchronous" disk abstraction
Elf32_EhdrELF file header (only used fields are commented)
Elf32_Phdr
Elf32_ShdrSection header (only used fields are commented)
FileHeader
FileSystemDefines the Nachos file system
FixedPrioritySchedulerData structures for the scheduler managing threads with a priority and a period
FixedPriorityThreadData structures for managing threads with a priority and a period
ICacheDefines a simple instruction cache
ICacheLine
InstructionDefines an instruction
InterruptDefines a low level interrupt hardware
KernelContextTDefines the kernel context Kernel context (host computer, SPARC) *** --------------------------------------------- The first 3 members correspond to the thread kernel context (stack, machine registers and stack pointer). As the kernel does not execute on the emulated MIPS processor, all values in the kernel context correspond to entities of the host computer (here, SPARC or i386)
List< Priority >Definition of a generic single-linked "list"
ListElement< Priority >Definition of a "list element"
LockDefines the "lock" synchronization tool
LRUDefinition of a "LRU algorithm"
LRUElementDefinition of a "LRU element"
MachineDefines the simulated execution hardware
MMUDefines a MMU - Memory Management Unit
Nachos_TimeDefines the Nachos basic time unit
OpenFileDefines the data structure maintained when a file is opened
OpenFileTableDefines a list of all opened files the class OpenFileTable maintain a list of all the open files in nachos and provides synchronisation between several threads wich use the same file
OpenFileTableEntryDefines the structure of a record in the open file table
OpInfo
OpString
PageFaultManagerDefines the page fault manager This object manages the page fault of the simulated MIPS processor for the Nachos kernel
PageTableBook
PageTableEntryDefines an entry in a simple translation table
PendingInterruptDefines an interrupt that is scheduled to occur in the future
PhysicalMemManagerImplements the physical page management
PhysicalMemManager::tpr_cDescribes the allocation of physical pages
ProcessDefines the data structures to keep track of the execution environment of a user program
ProcessStatDefines statistics that concern a particular process
Scheduler
SemaphoreDefines the "semaphore" synchronization tool
Statistics
SyscallErrorDefines a structure to store syscall error messages
ThreadData structures for managing threads
TimerDefines a hardware timer
TLBDefines a simple TLB (Translate Look-aside Buffer)
TLBEntryDefines an entry in the TLB
TranslationTableDefines the data structures used for address translation
UserContextTDefines the User context (MIPS virtual machine) User context (emulated computer, MIPS) *** ---------------------------------------------
